review_blob:
Mazama Brewery. Draft. 

Wow. Serious beer drinkers need to give this beer a try. Mazama is putting out some interesting stuff that many NW beer drinkers are unfamiliar with...or at least skeptical about. Im just not a Belgian or doppelbock guy, but this stop really surprised me. There is more taste here than I can describe. Its got...well...something. Its different. Its unique. Smooth and easy to drink, and pretty light for a 9.9%. Well, I guess technically it is a lager, but you wouldnt guess it without reading the label. 

 My only gripe is they wouldnt let me get a growler of it, and I would have gladly paid for it. Really curious to bring this one back home to Bend and see what my IPA friends think. They are selling it in bottles at the brewery, but that doesnt work for me. 

Anyway, if youre in Corvallis, find this brewery and try this beer. It will be worth the stop. Also try the Grand Crux. Between these two beers, Mazama has something unique for NW beer drinkers to talk about.
Mazama Brewery. Draft. This beer gets better the longer it ages. Its a good pint. Really taste the cloves and nutmeg. Good stuff.
COD. Seattle airport. Draft. Tough beer to drink. Had a grain taste. More lager like than pale ale. Wont drink another pint.
COD. Seattle airport. Clear Amber color. Fruity. Taste like a pack of juicy fruit chewing gum.
COD tasting. draft. Redmond airport. Fantastic beer. perfect color, aromic, perfect balance. Great breakfast beverage. Good job Boneyard.
Bottle. Wow, a lager? This is good beer. Plenty of hop and body and aroma. Crisp. Could drink a lot of this on a hot day, which is what a lager is good for I guess.
beer_name: Widmer Brothers Rotator IPA Series - Hopside Down IPL (India Pale Lager)

review_blob: HQT night: Bottle. Good crisp beer with a clear amber color. Very spicy...noticeably spicy. A hot peppery aftertaste. Cant wait to drink one of these Cascade Brewery from the tap

HQT night: Bottle. Good amber color and head. Just nothing wrong with this beer. Strong hop aroma, plenty of bite. Refreshing. Crisp. Dry. Thumbs up...cant wait to get one of these at the brewery from the tap.

beer_brewer_name: Klamath Basin Brewing / The Creamery Brew Pub & Grill
review_blob: HQT night: Growler. This beer got better the more I drank it. The initial aroma was not pleasant, and the texture was a little greasy. Funkie smell. Decent but not something I will search out and find again.
beer_name: Klamath Basin Pelican Butte Pale Ale

review_blob: HQT night: Growler. This beer poured a cloudy amber color. Looked almost like an unfiltered beer. The dry hop aroma was awesome, and the taste and enjoyment of this beer did not disappoint. Maybe a slight mushroom and grass hint. Very good stuff.
beer_name: GoodLife Mountain Rescue Dry Hop Pale Ale

review_blob: HQT night: Growler. This beer smells like a pot cookie. Wow. Its not terrible, but several HQT judges came up with the same deScription. Overall a decent beer, with clear amber color. Maybe a little greasy and thick. Decent beer.

HQT night. Draft at Brewery. This is a very good vanilla porter. I think the color was appealing, Not overpowering vanilla aroma or after taste, but it was certainly there. Just a hint of chocolate....much less bold tastes than the house Porter...Fencepost. I would drink the fencepost first, but this beer has nothing to be embarrassed about.
HQT night. Draft from Brewery. Very good beer. Dark color...almost black, and extremely powerful smoke and chocolate tastes. Great beer with a meal.
HQT Beer night. Draft from Brewery. Plenty of hazalnut aroma. Maybe a little on the sweet side. Decent beer from a little known, but very good brewery.

HQT Octoberfest. Growler. This was a pretty good German style lager. Clear, crisp... Easy drinking with not over powering German beer aroma and aftertaste. Palate was really good... perfect carbonation and texture... what you would expect from a seasonal lager.

HQT Octoberfest. 500 ml. bottle. I guess Im just a wet blanket but I didnt think this was an enjoyable beer at all. A little on the thick side, with a bitter aftertaste. Didnt like the silage smell. I think it was a good light beer, that you could drink all day. Imsure it taste better on tap... and on Germany. Ill make sure to give it a second chance when Im there.

HQT Octoberfest. Bottle. This was a great fest beer, using north west hops. Certainly didnt have German October fest characteristics, which is fine by me. Good color, good hop, good malt balance. Just a good beer. Glad it was here because drinking some of that German shit was pretty unpleasant.
HQT Octoberfest. Bottle. Poured clear. Crisp. Easy drinking, with district German hop and yeast characteristics. A little alcohol aftertaste. Pretty good for German beer.
COD grading - Dale. Bottle from Safeway Redmond Oregon. Foamy pour, deep red. Carmel, with plenty of hops. a little thick. pretty good for a winter beer... Id take it over a jubal ale.

beer_brewer_name: Klamath Basin Brewing / The Creamery Brew Pub & Grill
review_blob:
HQT Night. Growler. Holy vanilla! Over kill. This beer had lots of potential, but just didnt live up. Ill try it again, as it was complex and had alot going. Just a bit thin and over hyped. Perhaps the next batch...

 Still... if you like porter, with some sweet hints... go for it.
HQT Night. Bottle. Best beer of the night. Not overpowering wheat taste. just a good refreshing hef. Good citrus smell. Cloudy pour as would be expected.

HQT night. Bottle. Tasted like a sour apple martini... our a caramel apple candy. Not terrible... but more of a cider than a beer. I call it a girl n beer... wife lived it. My bottle had yeast sediment.

HQT night. Bottle. Perfect red color. thick head. Creamy finish. Very distinct aftertaste. Hops really pucker the tongue. Just a prefect beer... good seasonal companion to sierra nevada pale ale. kudos.

HQT night. Bottle. Not bad for a bottle. A little thick, chewy. Smelt like a Christmas tree. Maybe hints of chocolate. This beer had so many taste and aromas that it was distracting. Certainly it is not a blend beer... just a lot going on. Maybe to much.

beer_brewer_name: Klamath Basin Brewing / The Creamery Brew Pub & Grill
review_blob: HQT Night. Growler. Sweet chocolate hints, Poured dark rd, cloudy. This beer tasted good, better than it smelt. probably the best beer Ive had from this brewery.

HQT night. Bottle. This beer just didnt work for me. Perhaps I had a bad bottle, this I had a sour milk scent when I poured. It came out a dark cloudy red. Ill need to try a draft, and see if I can bump this score up a bit.
HQT night... Bottle. Great color. Maybe a slight cinnamon aroma. perfect hop/ aroma balance... just a really good red. Would like to try it on tap.

HQT Night. light colored.... doesnt pour red... tested this beer with red ales, which really isnt fair. certainly not a good beer when competing against red ales. Overall though. it was drinkable... and much better than an Coors typical American lager.
Bottle. clear straw color. not much aroma. perhaps a tad over carbonated. just a bland lager... Ive had better, had worse.

beer_brewer_name: Klamath Basin Brewing / The Creamery Brew Pub & Grill
review_blob: HGT night. Draft... growler from brewery. Strong wheat smell. a little thick on my pallet.

Flat Tail brewery, Draft: This is my favorite Flat Tail beer. Good color, strong hop aroma. Crisp. Very drinkable and safe...especially coming from Flat Tail which brews a LOT of different style of beers. You never know what you are going to get.
beer_name: Flat Tail Rough Cut India Pale Ale

review_blob:
Mazama Brewery, Draft: WOW! This beer will knock you on your ass if youre not careful. 

Great color. Dark...great texture, thick, but not offensive like some stouts. Just a hint of bourbon, but did not overpower the chocolate and coffee hints. Nor was it too sweet like many baltic porters can be. Just pretty good sipping beer. I recommend it with a meal, or a sipping session on the deck. Thumbs up. Good job boys.
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013

Mazama Brewery, Draft: This was not my favorite beer of the night. I didnt like the cloudy pour, and I thought it might be a tad thick. The aroma was okay, but overall, I was left disappointed. Like I said, its not a horrible beer, but I think they have other options that I would drink next time. Overall, this brewery has quality beer...a lot to choose from.

Mazama Brewery, Draft: DRY! Very dry. I liked it, it didnt have overpowering sweet aftertaste like many porters have. Perfect carbonation and hop/malt balance. Not to thick...not too watery. This is good porter, the best I found in Corvallis. I would put up against a blind tasting of Deschutes Porter any day.

Mazama Brewery, Draft: This is good beer. They use trappist yeast with North West Hops to make a Belgian, that really works. Great color, great mouth feel. I recommend it and I hope they continue to keep it on tap.
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013

Mazama Brewery, draft: Tasted sweet...to sweet. I thought the color and texture were good, especially for a Belgian. Good beer...the Belgian flavors are not overpowering, even in this dubbel. I would drink it again. But it certainly a sipping beer.
Mazama Brewery, Draft. This is a decent blond ale. I was pleasantly surprised, especially since it is in the Blond classification. Good summer beer.
Silver Moon. Draft. Bend Oregon. Decent beer. A little cloudy. Slightly on the sweet side. Good for an Amber. Good brewery.
Bottle. Perfect color... deep amber. Great aroma. Great hop aroma and taste. Citrus overtones. Balanced. Perhaps the only thing that would make this beer better is if it was a draft.

Draft. Worthy Brewery, Bend Oregon. COD beer tasting - Dale Crawford. This was good beer. Had a fruity aroma and taste. Not overpowering and not offensive. Lacked the bite that the regular IPA had, but certainly a drinkable beer. Carbonation and mouth feel were fine....not exciting but certainly nothing to criticize. Average to below average Bend IPA.

Draft. Worthy Brewery. COD tasting night - Dale Crawford. I damn near sent this beer back it looks so unappealing. light milky, cloudy yellow. Almost like a spoiled hef. However, dont let the appearance fool you. This is a good beer. 50 IBUs...not bad at all for experimental pale. I ordered a second pint before I left the brewery.

Draft. Worthy Brewery. COD tasting night - Dale Crawford. Disappointed. It was a little bit flat and thick. Stuck to the side of my mouth. Probably will not try this beer again. Needed more kick to impress me as a double IPA.

Draft. Worthy Brewery. COD tasting night - Dale Crawford. By far the best beer in the brewery. This is good stuff, good IPA...comparable with any Central Oregon IPAs, and that is saying something coming from Bend Oregon, the beer mecca of the NW. I highly recommend it. to anyone who is passing through Bend.

Draft. Worthy Brewery. COD tasting night - Dale Crawford. This a was a pretty good Bock. It was good color for a lager, and had plenty of hop characteristics. Maybe a little bit bready smellin, but not an unpleasant drink at all.

Draft. Worthy Brewery. COD tasting night - Dale Crawford. This was a good beer. Perfect color, plenty of hop and bitterness. The only real criticism I have is it was a little thick and sticky on the roof of my mouth. Over all. Can really taste the Centennial hops.

Bottle. HGT Brew club tasting night. Blahhhh. Could be worse I guess. This beer is perhaps a step above a coors or a budweiser...but nothing to brag about. In a blind tasting, I picked a PBR over this beer.

Bottle. HGT Brew club tasting night. This was not the worse beer Ive had. Its very light and very carbonated. I think the carbonation actually makes this beer better...hides the tin taste from the can somewhat.
